title: Apparent weight-two elevators at constant velocity

content.question: Elevator <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is moving upward at a constant speed of <math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math> and Elevator <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is moving downward at a constant speed of <math alttext="2 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>. In each elevator, a <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> object is on a scale. The scale in Elevator <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> reads <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and the scale in Elevator <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> reads <math alttext="F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub A, is greater than F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> because Elevator <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is moving up while Elevator <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is moving down.

<math alttext="F sub A, is greater than F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> because Elevator <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has a greater speed than Elevator <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>.

<math alttext="F sub A, equals F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> because two objects with the same mass always have the same apparent weight.

<math alttext="F sub A, equals F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> because both elevators are traveling with a constant speed.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub A, equals F sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math> because both elevators are traveling with a constant speed.
